title: Hosea Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Hosea with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 14 chapters.

questions.question: Who was Hosea commanded to take as a wife?
questions.explanation: God commanded Hosea to take Gomer, a wife of whoredoms, as a sign of Israel's unfaithfulness.

questions.question: What was the name of Hosea’s first son?
questions.explanation: Hosea's first son was named Jezreel to signify the coming judgment on the house of Jehu.

questions.question: Why was Hosea’s daughter named Lo-ruhamah?
options: Because God would have mercy on Israel
Because God would no longer have mercy on Israel
Because she was born in Jezreel
Because she was destined to be a prophetess
questions.correctAnswer: Because God would no longer have mercy on Israel
questions.explanation: Lo-ruhamah means 'not having mercy,' indicating God’s judgment on Israel.

questions.question: What does the name Loammi mean?
questions.explanation: God said to call Hosea’s son Loammi, meaning 'not my people,' signifying Israel's broken relationship with God.

questions.question: According to Hosea 1:10, the number of the children of Israel shall be as what?
questions.explanation: The children of Israel will be numerous as the sand of the sea, signifying restoration.

questions.question: In Hosea 4:1, what three things are said to be lacking in the land?
options: Truth, mercy, and knowledge of God
questions.correctAnswer: Truth, mercy, and knowledge of God
questions.explanation: The land lacked truth, mercy, and knowledge of God leading to judgment.

questions.question: What is one of the sins mentioned in Hosea 4:2 that the people committed?
questions.explanation: The people sinned by swearing, lying, killing, stealing, and committing adultery.

questions.question: What does Hosea say will happen to the land because of the sins of the people?
options: It shall be cleansed by fire
It shall be given to strangers
questions.explanation: The land shall mourn and all that dwell therein shall languish due to sin.

questions.question: According to Hosea 4:6, why are God's people destroyed?
questions.explanation: God says His people are destroyed for lack of knowledge because they rejected knowledge.

questions.question: In Hosea 4:12, from what do the people of Israel ask counsel?
questions.explanation: The people sought guidance from idols (stocks and staffs) rather than God.

questions.question: What metaphor is used in Hosea 4:16 to describe Israel?
questions.explanation: Israel is compared to a backsliding heifer who needs to be fed.

questions.question: According to Hosea 7:4, what are the people of Israel compared to?
options: An oven heated by the baker
questions.correctAnswer: An oven heated by the baker
questions.explanation: They are like an oven heated by the baker, ceasing from raising until leavened.

questions.question: In Hosea 7:11, Ephraim is likened to what kind of bird?
questions.explanation: Ephraim is compared to a silly dove without heart, calling to Egypt and Assyria.

questions.question: What is the main reason for the downfall of Israel according to Hosea 7:13?
options: Their fleeing from God and transgression
questions.correctAnswer: Their fleeing from God and transgression
questions.explanation: Because they fled from God and transgressed, they faced destruction.

questions.question: What does Hosea 10:1 describe Israel as?
questions.explanation: Israel is described as an empty vine that brings forth fruit to itself.

questions.question: According to Hosea 10:12, what are the people instructed to do?
options: Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy
Build altars on the high places
questions.correctAnswer: Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy
questions.explanation: They are commanded to seek the LORD until He rains righteousness.

questions.question: What will happen to the king of Israel according to Hosea 10:15?
options: He will be victorious in battle
He will be exalted by God
questions.explanation: Because of great wickedness, the king of Israel will be utterly cut off.

questions.question: In Hosea 11:1, what is said about Israel's relationship with God?
options: God called Israel out of Egypt
Israel was chosen above all nations
questions.correctAnswer: God called Israel out of Egypt
questions.explanation: God expresses His love by recalling calling Israel out of Egypt like a father.

questions.question: According to Hosea 11:8, how does God describe His feelings towards Ephraim?
options: He is angry and will destroy them
He is like a lion roaring
He is moved to compassion and will not execute His fierce anger
questions.correctAnswer: He is moved to compassion and will not execute His fierce anger
questions.explanation: God’s heart is turned within Him; He will not destroy Ephraim.

questions.question: What does Hosea 12:6 urge the people to do?
options: Keep mercy and judgment, and wait on God continually
questions.correctAnswer: Keep mercy and judgment, and wait on God continually
questions.explanation: The people are called to return to God with mercy and judgment and wait on Him.

questions.question: In Hosea 13:4, what does God say about other gods?
options: They are all false and cannot save
They are powerful and to be feared
They are just like the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: They are all false and cannot save
questions.explanation: God declares He is the only savior; other gods cannot save.

questions.question: What is the main theme of Hosea chapter 14?
questions.explanation: Chapter 14 is a plea for Israel to return to God and receive healing and blessings.

questions.question: In Hosea 14:5, God says He will be like what to Israel?
questions.explanation: God promises to be as the dew to Israel, enabling growth and renewal.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Hosea 14:9: 'Who is wise, and he shall understand these things? prudent, and he shall know them? for the ways of the LORD are ________, and the just shall walk in them: but the transgressors shall fall therein.'
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes the correctness of God's ways.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea was the son of Beeri.
questions.explanation: Hosea is identified as the son of Beeri in the opening verse.

questions.question: True or False: God said He would no longer have mercy on the house of Judah.
questions.explanation: God said He would no longer have mercy on Israel, but He would have mercy on Judah.

questions.question: True or False: The people of Israel sought counsel from God in Hosea's time.
questions.explanation: They sought counsel from their stocks and staffs (idols), not from God.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea compares Israel to a cake not turned in chapter 7.
questions.explanation: Ephraim is compared to a cake not turned, indicating incompleteness and instability.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 10:3 says Israel had no king because they feared the LORD.
questions.explanation: They had no king because they did not fear the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 11:9 indicates God will utterly destroy Ephraim for their sins.
questions.explanation: God says He will not execute His fierce anger and will show compassion.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 12:3 refers to Jacob wrestling with the angel and prevailing.
questions.explanation: The chapter recounts Jacob's wrestling and prevailing with God.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 13:9 describes God's wrath as a consuming fire.
questions.explanation: The chapter portrays God's anger as a fire that burns in Zion.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 14:3 says that Asshur will save Israel.
questions.explanation: The verse says Asshur shall not save Israel.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Hosea 4:6: 'My people are destroyed for lack of ________: because thou hast rejected knowledge, I will also reject thee.'
questions.explanation: The verse highlights destruction due to lack of knowledge.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Hosea 10:12: 'Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in ________; break up your fallow ground.'
questions.explanation: Sowing righteousness and reaping mercy is an exhortation to repentance.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Hosea 14:4: 'I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for mine anger is turned _______ from him.'
questions.explanation: God promises healing and turning away His anger.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Hosea 1:2: 'And the LORD said to Hosea, Go, take unto thee a wife of ________ and children of whoredoms.'
questions.explanation: The wife and children symbolize Israel's unfaithfulness.

questions.question: What city is mentioned in Hosea 1:4 as the place where God will avenge the blood of Jezreel?
questions.explanation: Jezreel is the valley and city associated with judgment on Israel.

questions.question: According to Hosea 4:15, which place should Israel not come to, lest Judah offend?
questions.explanation: God commands Israel not to come to Gilgal to avoid offending Judah.

questions.question: In Hosea 7:7, what is said about the kings of Israel?
options: They are fallen and none calls unto God
They are strengthened by the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: They are fallen and none calls unto God
questions.explanation: All kings have fallen and none seek God in Hosea's time.

questions.question: According to Hosea 10:5, what will the inhabitants of Samaria fear?
questions.explanation: The calves of Bethaven represent idolatry and judgment.

questions.question: What does Hosea 11:3 say God taught Ephraim to do?
questions.explanation: God taught Ephraim to walk, taking them by their arms.

questions.question: What does Hosea 12:10 say God sent to Israel?
questions.explanation: God sent a prophet to Israel to guide them.

questions.question: What is the punishment described in Hosea 13:16 for Samaria?
options: The head of the infant dashed in pieces
questions.correctAnswer: The head of the infant dashed in pieces
questions.explanation: The punishment is harsh, indicating the fall of Samaria.

questions.question: According to Hosea 14:7, those who dwell under Israel's shadow shall return and grow like what?
questions.explanation: They shall revive as corn and grow as the vine.
